Game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game Class sets up the Cluedo game including the players, the start positions, the board and deals out the cards. All actions that the player makes are then set to the corresponding objects through this class

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.InvalidAction
      Indicates an attempt to make an invalid move.

      Constructs a new game by constructs a new Board.

      • makeSuggestion

        public void makeSuggestion(Player player,
                           java.util.List<Card> suggestionList,
                           Card refuted)
                    throws Game.InvalidAction
        Adds suggestion and refuted card to players lists. Checks suggested characters current position and sets it to the new room swaps weapons between rooms.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who made the suggestion
        suggestionList - the list of suggestions
        refuted - the refuted card from other player
        Throws:
        Game.InvalidAction - if the move is invalid or user input the wrong arguments

      • checkAccusation

        public boolean checkAccusation(java.util.List<Card> accusation)
        Checks the accusation cards with the solution.
        Parameters:
        accusation - the list of accusation cards
        Returns:
        true if all the accusation is right, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the accusation is null or the number of cards is not 3

        public Position isValidMove(Player player,
                            Board.Direction direct)
                     throws Game.InvalidAction
        Determines if the player has given a valid list of directions or not.
        Parameters:
        player - the current player
        direct - the direction to move
        Returns:
        the new position where the player will be moving to
        Throws:
        Game.InvalidAction - if the any of the given directions is invalid such as there's a wall

      • checkForDirections

        public boolean checkForDirections(java.lang.String directionList,
                                  int numRolls)
                           throws Game.InvalidAction
        Determines if the string is an valid direction list. Only WASD keys input are allowed. Splits the string to char array then iterates through to check whether the char is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        directionList - the list of direction in a string
        numRolls - the number of dice rolls
        Returns:
        True if the string is only contains 'WASD' letters, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        Game.InvalidAction - if the specified initial capacity is not WASD keys
